Good arguments are that movie has been making more then 3 years including 7 months of only filming acting. First time I have watched in theater was in okt-nov of 1980, like it suppose to be and like many of you first I was in company of my father. After that probably more then 10 times re-watched and I can clearly remembered difference in 70mm and 35mm versions. After cinema of course there was all sort of home watching so 100+ in all...There is so mush deep levels here, sub contest...Story from Lucas, Leigh, and Lawrence is so magical and mysterious...cuts for instance are made like you sub- conscience you have to wander what did you actually saw and watch again. Soooo refine direction of Kershner-brilliant! Cinematography of Suschitzky...woooow! You have black Dart Vader in dark room and you see everything...with unbelievable atmosphere. Do I even have to anything to add? John Williams! Ralph McQuarrie and whole Lucas crew made beautiful and expanded universe that has aspired us (and them to do more) since 1980. I just remembering that I was sad that could't stay back then in line, by thicket again and watch again again... Master-peace that in both ways (no need for better and again sadly) will never be repeated or outdone!

It's just the best Star Wars movie.

And fan fact when Vader say that he is Luke father ,the only people they knew that were George Lucas,Mark Hamil and James Earl Jones(Darth Vader's voice). David Prowse (Darth Vader) say another line .

I used to think that Return Of The Jedi was the best out of the original 3, and The Empire Strikes Back was the worst, but that was when I was a kid. Since then, I have grown up a bit more now and watched the 3 all over again. I now believe that Empire is clearly the best of the 3. Why is that? Because of the following things. 1. Best Plot out of the three and it shows you that it doesn't all come down to special effects. 2. The movie is very dark, revealing and more importantly it's realistic that the bad guys actually win.Like how many movies out there do u see the bad guys win? The trouble with other movies is they are so predictable in that you know what will happen. In Empire you don't. 3. Best acting by the cast out of the three. 4. The soundtrack, the best music score I have ever heard. It adds a lot to the movie. 5. Irvin Kershner did a fantastic job of directing, I wish George Lucas brought him back for episodes 2 and 3. The scenes with Luke in the cave was Brilliant. The Battle Of Hoth was great, but I really enjoyed the scenes on Dagobah with Yoda and Luke. Yoda telling us about the force and the brilliant ending. This movies is 5/5 stars and my favourite movie off all time In conclusion I wish George Lucas would watch TESB again and realise the prequels should be done the way empire was done. The Phantom Menace was above average but it is nowhere near as good as Empire and the WORST out of the 4.

If anyone is going to question George Lucas and his ability to write and direct Episode One, one needs to look no further than this movie here. Not only is this movie a great science-fiction masterpiece, it is a rich, dark, deep, and involving drama that takes this space opera to new heights. While the original was great, this movie improved on it in the basis that it WASN'T a Wild West movie in space. This was the Godfather in space. This was Casablanca in Space. Any great movie you have seen, this is it. It has everything one is looking for, plus the greatest few lines in movie history: "Obi-Wan never told you what happened to your father."  "He told me enough...He told me you killed him."  "No, I am your father."

Review_Title: Not the best Star Wars film like everybody says...
Review: I agree I really enjoy the Empire Strikes Back. Out of all the 4 Star Wars films I think that it is the second best of the lot. what annoys me is how unanimously most reviewers automatically point out that Return of the Jedi is the worst of the series.(Many even say that the childish film, TPM is better than ROTJ???!!huh???!!!!!!) To be quite frank, WHY?

The dramatic high point of the entire Star Wars saga remains the moment in Empire when Vader tempts a defeated Luke.  What Vader is offering is very enticing: come on kid lets you and me take over this universe.  There is also a genuine caring portrayed in Vader's voice.  There is a desperation in his words, like he realizes all he has for a legacy is his children. It's a brilliant scene, Lucas will never out-do it.

Review_Title: Awesome 2nd installment to the greatest trilogy of our time!!
Review: "The Empire Strikes Back" is a superb installment in the star wars trilogy. First, lets get started with the snow battle on the Ice planet of Hoth, Excellent!. The Imperial Walkers were inventive and another one of Lucas's great creations. The snow battle is my second favorite battle in the series next to Yavin. This films intensity was great. Vader had such dominate and evil presence, starting with hoth and ending with the best one on one confrontation I have ever seen in a movie, Vader vs Luke up top the most imaginative city of Bespin. Awesome!!!! I love the little green creature of yoda, who teaches Luke in the ways of the force.I love him not becuase he is unique and original but becuase he can act as well.Finally, I thought Boba Fett was an awesome bounty hunter and a great addition to threat of the empire. "Empire" focused on the darkness of star wars. It buried down into its mythology and made a strong backbone to the series. When C 3PO, R2, Leia, and Luke starred beyond into the outer rims of space at the films conclusion, never before have I been left with the curiousity and anticipation I felt at that moment. "Return of the Jedi" forfilled that anticipation and curiousity quite well may I add. I'll give " Empire" *** 1/2 out of **** stars. Classic!!!!

I saw this movie as a kid, and I have loved it ever since. This movie has excellent special effects (even for today), a great story, great characters, great music. I think the acting was the best of the trilogy. The lightsaber duel was breathtaking and the best of the trilogy, while Vader reveals to Luke the ultimate truth. The Empire Strikes Back will be watched and acclaimed generations down the road. One of the best films in movie history. perfect 10/10

Wow. That was the only thing I said when I saw this masterpiece. I believe the other two Star Wars films aren't half as good as this one. George Lucas made an excellent film that would be loved generation after generation. The cinematography was excellent, as well as the lightsaber duel (best of the Star Wars trilogy). The special effects are still mind-boggling today, even though it's made exactly 20 years old. Kudos to this film. 10/10

Review_Title: a step down in the Star Wars saga
Review: While not as good as the other Star Wars films, it's still a part of the best film trilogy ever made, and deserves respect despite its shortcomings. Still, I found it pretty boring.  It just didn't suit me.  A real step down for George Lucas and Co.

Review_Title: Lacking a bit in intensity, but not without it's charm.
Review: While part five delivered the eye-popping visuals and exotic locales that were expected, I found it to lack the intensity of the other films.  It didn't deliver much action and was paced rather slowly.  While I realize character development is important, most of the real good stuff got held until part six. It left me with the feeling that it was a filler between parts four and six.

Review_Title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
Review: Star Wars I really liked the movie and it was really exciting and cool I really like movies
While the child in me loves Return of the Jedi, the adult in me realizes that this installment of Star Wars is, in fact, the most well constructed film overall.

Review_Title: More than 20 times viewed and it NEVER gets old
Review: I literally watched this movie about twenty times when I first got it, VHS , a box-set of the original three. But this one is best! It was the most exciting, it kept you on the edge of your seat and your mind the whole way through. Although, I have to say, Lucas has become very lazy in the Star Wars saga since the Phantom Menace, which was quite poor. This is vintage Lucas and this your vintage space movie. Star Wars (any of the original 3 and Episode 3) is a must see! It includes many household names. Some, though, hate Star Wars with a vengeance. Those people lack in creativity and are subject to boring, lack-luster films. All I can say is have fun because I know you won't for missing out on this 5-star, one of a kind classic. Must see, it's too great for a 10 out of 10 rating. It was way ahead of its time. It's a film of the ages and has caliber modern films dream to re-create!

That statement alone could stir up controversy, with some saying that that title belongs to THE GODFATHER, PART II or THE DARK KNIGHT. While I agree that those sequels rank the best, I would still have to give the crown to THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK. It's marvelous! Energetic, funny, thrilling, dark and complex; it has everything for the audience to enjoy! There is not ONE slow moment; moving at the speed of a particular Corellian freighter through light speed without sacrificing any character development or story progression! Not just a perfect sequel, it's a perfect film! ESB just celebrated its 40th anniversary, and still feels so fresh! May the Force continue to be with the best sequel ever made!
Most Sequels are garbage but empire strikes back introduces and archives so much and it will always be considered it a game changer no wonder its an iconic peace of film.

This movie expands on everything the first movie does. This movie has the greatest plot twist in history and introduces so many new characters. The emperor boba fett Yoda lando. Without boba fett we wouldn't have the mandalorian or jango fett.

First I watched the episodes 1,2,3,7,8,9, then I watched the oldest movies. To be honest I didn't like the original trio. Prequels are better. I find the movie a bit boring comparing to the new ones. The plot is not very complex nor interesting. And because they are old, the aliens and the special effects look fake.

The sequel to the original Star Wars feels like it could be longer. Although, The sets and the action are even better than A New Hope. The Battle of Hoth is an epic and cinematic sequence that shows the creativity of the filmmakers. It will always be cringey to me because I am used to modern film, but even though the original trilogy released in the 80s it is fun to watch and experience the innovation.
I think it's a great sequel to the fourth movie and I really liked it

Review_Title: The Best Star Wars Film Yet
Review: Man This film has such good character development and Vader just kicks the ass of every rebel and of course "I am your Father" is just Awesome and Yoda's interactions with luke are just a banger and Han and leia play off together very well and it's so gripping as the Empire always is ahead of the Rebels and Han getting encased in whatever that is i forgot and Imperial March gets more intense than ever ,it's just a Awesome film,I love it.

This film is the sequel to the original Star Wars(1977). For a sequel I actually was really impressed by this movie for its beautiful art direction, visual effects and its musical score. I can also admit I adored the storyline a lot because the character development grows a lot more than the previous film. But I can tell you all this right now this really isn't a kids movie as much as the other Star Wars films. This is definitely more darker in many ways especially Luke's side of the story. But then again that darkness and maturity brought one of the most famous lines in movie history, "Luke I am your Father". Okay so overall I give this movie a 9 out of 10 for accomplishing everything a sequel needs. One thing though, you probably might all know but this movie leads to another sequel Return of the Jedi. SPOILER-someone gets captured and Luke and Leia have to rescue him. That means this movie has no ending but still I say this movie IS THE BEST OF 1980!!

This has to be the best of the six star wars films. It is just one of those timeless classics that never get old as you watch them. In empire, the skills of the actors have grown with age, to better the people we see on screen. Also, the introduction of yoda stands as a strong point for the entire series. The bright introduction of the classic Han Solo/Leia romance comes to surface, and the most famous star wars line is spoken, "I am your father," by vader. Lucas brings to the table action, suspense, romance, light comedy, intense drama and fantasy wrapped into one amazing movie.

Review_Title: The epitome of what the 2nd installment of a trilogy is!!!
Review: I will summarize my comments in one short conversation a friend and I had three weeks ago.  We were discussing Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers.  I was voicing my displeasure with the utter predictability of the show and total lack of any climactic event and being left with a feeling of absolutely nothing happened in that film.  My friend replied with the comment, "That's what the "middle" film of a trilogy is.  It is simply the glue for the first and third films.  Not every trilogy is STAR WARS."  My point exactly.  Empire is still light years ahead of itself simply because it is still the only "middle film" of a trilogy to keep you on the edge of your seat and leave you taken aback by its own climactic events and revelations.  We can all remember the first time we saw the Battle of Hoth and were blown away, also who cannot say their world was sent for a spin when we found out Darth was Luke's father.  We all have our own personal moments with STAR WARS.  The music still stirs our souls and is prevalent in our society.  Ask any Raiders fan if they enjoy the Imperial March.  It is a part our culture.

Review_Title: The greatest example of theatrical cinema ever!
Review: The Empire Strikes Back will forever be the epitome of theatrical cinema, as envisioned by Wagner. Cherish it, the art of film-making in this way is lost.

This movie is really great. All the actors did a remarkable job. I especially enjoyed the Cantina scene where we meet Chewbaca. My favorite character has to be C-3PO. This so cool for my 2006 senior prom at my high school the theme is "Star Wars" the interior of the building is supposed to be a replica of the Cantina. I especially enjoyed Frank Oz as Yoda. Mark Hamill was great as Luke Skywalker. Alec Guinness was good to. I loved Carrie Fisher as Princess Leia. "R2D2 it is you" said by C-3PO is probably my favorite quote. James Earl Jones is one heck of a great actor as the voice of Darth Vader. I liked this movie because it is so great all by itself but also as part of the trilogy.

Have you ever loved something so much, that when you sat down to discuss what exactly it is about it that you adore, you could not find the words? That is how I feel about the Empire Strikes back: And I haven't a clue how I am going to express myself in less than 1000 words, but by god I will try.

This is my favorite movie of all time. I grew up watching the original trilogy and I have been into Star Wars and movies ever since. This movie and King Kong are really important to me because if it was'nt for them I would'nt be the same. Anyway the plot summary. The plot is great and original. I love how this was one of the first movies where the baddies win. Come on the bad guys gotta win sometime. It is'nt fair that the goodie tooshoo's always win. The effects are some of the best I've ever seen. They were the best in their time and the best today. The acting is great as well. The actors take great passion and empathy in their roles and it helps make the movie so great. Overall this is the best movie ever made and if you have'nt seen it you are missing out.

Review_Title: Best of the saga is an understatement.
Review: The first instalment established the premise and the mythology of Star Wars, but the characterisation is defined in Empire Strikes Back. Often regarded as the quintessential sequel, Empire Strikes Back emphasises more depth with the characters depicted through emotional dilemmas.

"This review contains minor spoilers from the film" First, I dare NOT spoil ANYTHING about this film. Now, this film picks things up from the first Star Wars, and makes it much darker in tone. The scenes in this film are just PHENOMENAL. Seriously, the Hoth battle scene, the Asteroid Field, training with Yoda, Bespin, and OF COURSE; the final battle of Luke vs Vader. Luke is a great up and coming Jedi, Han and Leia are good and their growing chemistry is interesting to watch. And Yoda. Yoda is a BOSS. No joke, his role in the film is FREAKING IMPACTFUL, more than anyone else, on the ENTIRE TRILOGY. In conclusion, YES WATCH THIS MOVIE. YES ENJOY IT FROM START TO FINISH. AND YES, I give it a rating of 9.7 out of 10.
It was terrific but i'm not sure if it's the best one in the series or not, i'll say after watching the whole series.

This has got to be one of the best films of all time!!!!!!! (besides Stand By Me). Better than the 4, and 6!!!!!!! The acting was far more improved and Yoda!!! :D!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This has got to be the best out of the original! If you haven't seen this movie for shame!!!! You missed out on one of the worlds biggest movies. See A New Hope before this, or all the prequels.

Review_Title: One of the greatest movies of all time!
Review: A Masterpiece. One of the greatest achievements in cinema history. This is the best episode in the epic Star Wars saga.
Everyone "knows" that sequels are never as good as the original.

Although The Empire Strikes Back is the darkest of the trilogy, it encompasses a lot more emotion.  It combines passion, fear, immaturity, betrayal, hatred, growth and love.  The score, I believe is the best ever written, ever piece of music tells a story and the music alone can make my cry or give me chills.  In the Empire Strikes Back Luke has a coming of age, Leia accepts her Love of Han, and even Yoda and Ben learn from Luke.  My favorite character in the Empire Strikes Back is Han Solo.  My favorite line is "Laugh it up Fuzzball." and my favorite part is the final scene between Vader and Luke.  When Luke lets go of the structure and falls into the abyss I get tears of joy everytime.  Watch it, you learn about love, friendship, growing and you just might learn something about yourself.

Review_Title: The greatest movie of all time!
Review: George Lucas was a brilliant writer.  He knew how take the age old plot line of an ordinary boy becoming a legendary hero, through the trials of life, death and romance.  He topped it off by giving it a futuristic, science fiction twist.  Between the three of his movies this one was the best.  It developed the viewer's perception of the Empire and how rotten and evil it truly was.  It developed Darth Vader's character into something that would make us shudder just hearing him breath.  It clarified this mysterious power called the "force."  It contained outstanding battle scenes, on land, in space and man to man.  Finally, it set up our curiosity about Jabba the Hutt and the Emperor himself.  This had to be best movie of all time.  I wasn't big on Lucas' additions to the originals, but he managed not to tamper too much with this one.

Review_Title: The best out of the trilogy!
Review: Even though George Lucas did not come back to direct this one, this movie was the best of the trilogy. The emotions can be felt between Han and Leia, as the other ones did not have this feeling. This movie also included the most brilliant sequence in movie history of all time: The Asteroid Field, along with the Battle of Hoth. This movie will awe you with its gorgeous choice of colors (get the special edition for best viewing), and emotions that pop out at you.

The middle film of George Lucas' trilogy is by far the best film of the three. Eschewing the cheap look and near-campiness of Star Wars, and not having yet succumbed to the commercialzation and dearth of fresh ideas that is Return of the Jedi, Empire broadens Lucas' canvas in sweeping epic strokes and fully develops its dark, brooding themes. While Star Wars is an exercise in pure escapism, Empire takes its characters, and us, down a dark path. Consider: Luke is revealed to be Vader's son, Han and Leia begin a seemingly doomed romance, the rebellion lies in near ruin, Yoda and Obi-Wan believe Luke will fail at his quest -- and he does. I don't think are on Tatooine anymore, Artoo!

Review_Title: The best of the original trilogy.
Review: George Lucas' 1977 space saga STAR WARS was supposed to be as good as it could get.  Completely flawless movie. The good guys and bad guys were well defined.  The young dreamer goes on to save the universe from a fate worse than death, etc...Then, 3 years later, the adventure continued.  THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK went on to further the adventures of Luke, Han and Leia in their never-ending battle against the Galactic Empire.  Considered by many to be the "darkest" chapter of the original trilogy, this film gave us everything we wanted and more. Luke is just learning to temper his Jedi skills, romance FINALLY blooms between Han and Leia, and Chewbacca is still unintelligible as hell.  Vader at this point, is stewing over the loss of the defeat at the hands of the Alliance, and will let nothing get in his way of crushing the rebels.  This is THE ultimate Star Wars to see. JEDI is still a good movie, but EMPIRE rules.

Review_Title: The best movie IÂ´ve ever seen
Review: I donÂ´t think that I need to say many thingÂ´s about this movie. It is simply the best one which was ever produced.I can only tell the people which havenÂ´t still seen this movie: Take the time and watch this film, you wonÂ´t regret it. If I had the possibility, I would give eleven out of ten points, but unfortunately thatÂ´s not possible.

IÂ´ve seen this movie...very often. I think it is the best movie of all time because he is very exciting and there is romance and there is magic and there is great music and...in the special edition(which I prefer) there are also very good, modern special effects. I think that this movie is not as overstripped as episode one, but perhaps Lucas wanted to do this in this movie,too, but the technologie wasnÂ´t as far as he needed it to realize this story how she was in his brain. But what he made, is the best movie of all times, the others are very very good, too, but ep.1,4 and 6 donÂ´t have...I donÂ´t now what they donÂ´t have, but this movie has it. I could watch it again and again. I think that this is the darkest movie of the four ones, there are many people killed by Darth Vader only because he doesnÂ´t forgive them mistakes, and the lightsaber duell between Vader and Luke is brilliant. The hunt through the asteroid field is very exciting  and of course the battle in the snow is very exciting, too. I would like to say, that the special edition is not as bad as some people want to make her. It is not a directorÂ´s cut where it is possible that the story changes or you see another message. It is a special edition with only one really important new scene, but the story of course doesnÂ´t change. The Sp.Ed. has a brilliant sound, there are some new special effect, but not every old effect was deleted, which I think is so because these effect are part of the legend of star wars. The quality of the picture has improved very much, I donÂ´t understand why people say that the Sp.Ed. is bull***t. They canÂ´t expect to see a new movie, they have to expect a better quality of all, and they get it.

I saw "The Empire Strikes Back" first when it came out in the Special Edition. I didn't expect to like it, so you can imagine my surprise. The entire film blew me away. I was amazed by the emotional impact. Princess Leia became a role model, Han Solo became an object of lust. I knew before seeing it, I wanted a career in movies, but this one helped me make up my mind for certain. I used to have over 10 different favorite movies, including West Side Story and Rebel Without A Cause, but I found that Empire left me breathless every time. In my opinion, The Empire Strikes Back is the best cinematic experience in history, and will remain the best.

Review_Title: Backbone of the Star Wars saga
Review: This movie serves so many purposes and accomplishes them all.  TESB does a fantastic job of bridging the gap between an intro and a conclusion to a great saga.  Not only that, but this great sequel builds character involvement and plot.  An all time great and easily the best of the Star Wars movies, one gets a true feel for the story and what the characters are going through.  ROTJ and a New Hope do not give you this same feeling.  A new Hope is simply meant to introduce the characters (Lucas alluded to this), and ROTJ wraps things up.  On a personal note I watch this one the most and never get sick of it.  It is definitely the meat and potatoes of Star Wars.
***SEMI-SPOILERS HEREIN***
Hello Friends,

Review_Title: You know what? I didn't like it!
Review: I wasn't planning to comment on this movie, but after reading nothing but good from all the others, I decided to give you my opinion anyway. The story (if you can speak of one)in this movie is very boring. There isn't any tention-building or climax whatsoever. The movie just stops after 2 hours. There is hardly any character building, and to my opinion there aren't many strong personalities. The only character that has won my sympathy is Han Solo,(Harrison Ford) but after being frozen he just disappears out of the movie, and noone seems to care about him anymore. Luke Skywalker is a w***er who is supposed to be a jedi knight, but instead he needs to be rescued all the time. I wouldn't have cared less if he had crashed in his plane, had been eaten by that snowmonster, had frozen to death, he got shot by the ATATs, if his father had killed him, or he had fallen of that tower. The music score is well composed, though I think a classical symphony isn't very suitable for a sci-fi movie. I believe they should have used synthetic music to create the right atmosphere. On the other hand the effects and sceneries are very impressive. Unbelieve what effort George and his guys have done!

Review_Title: One of the best movies ever written
Review: I don't think I could ever say anything more than just this. As a young girl watching this, I was captivated by the love theme between Leia and Han first and foremost the tension between them as she put Han in his place at first with that first scene, but then gradually things turn around in a bittersweet way between them in what was a heartfelt way.

Review_Title: The only SW movie that really rocks
Review: I saw this film again yesterday..and i remember now why i used to be a Star Wars fan. This is THE SW movie! Harrison Ford is just PERFECT as Han Solo. Watch his acting in this one, and then go and see no 1-3.
The Empire Strikes Back is one of the all time classic movies that everyone should see.

Review_Title: Ive got a gooood feeling about this.
Review:
By far BEST STAR WARS MOVIE. Luke's journey

from a farm boy to a jedi is what makes it so good and Han and Lea's love story on the other hand finishes it. DARTH VADER = BEST VILLAIN.

Review_Title: The best one in the classic trilogy
Review: Ah yes, my favourite hollywood franchise. This one is excellent and is the best among the other movies of the classic star wars trilogy. A classic epic.

Although it is not the happiest of the 3 Star Wars films (I'm not even considering the pseudo-Star Wars rubbish Lucas is putting out now to pre-cursor the greatest trilogy ever concieved), it is my fav.  Perhaps it is the films darkness that make it slightly better than the other 2.  I have never watched a film more times and hoped for a differnet outcome than this one.  Everytime I see it I hope that somehow Luke chooses to stay with Yoda and finish his training.  Anyway.  Best of the 3, no doubt.
This is the best thing I've seen in my life, and it's worth watching.

Review_Title: Probably the "worst" of the original three
Review: While this was a good movie, I just don't understand how some people can claim that this is the best of the original trilogy.  I would rate Star Wars and Return of the Jedi above it.  As I recall, that was also the general consensus soon after they were first released.  At the time, people generally thought Empire was good, but were a little disappointed.  When Jedi came out, it seemed as though people were much more satisfied, similar to the early reviews of Episode II (favorable) compared to Episode I (not up to expectations).

Episode V is without a doubt the most different of all the Star Wars Films, and yet it manages to be everything we know and love about Star Wars. Who knows why? Was it because of the writing, directing, and production? Was it Lucas' intent for the movie to be this much different? I don't have the answers. But I do have a movie to review. I would call ESB the most atmospheric, exiting, and well-paced of the series. The development of the Han/Leia tension which started in the first film is going full steam ahead here, with some of the best one-liners in the history of one-liners. It's sad that this tension completely dies in Return of the Jedi; just because they love each other doesn't mean they can't fight any more! The action scenes in episode V are, IMHO, second only to the huge battle at the end of Ep VI. I don't have the wide-screen version, so I'll have to admit that I've never seen it in all of it's glory, but the star destroyer chase/asteroid sequence is incredible (i.e. the podrace in epI is a drive to moosejaw in comparison). The plot in ep V takes some very cool twists: the introduction of a new mentor for Luke, some revelations about his origins, and a conflict between his destiny as a Jedi and his love for his friends. I'm not sure which of the three writers of this film are responsible for this stuff, but it's presented here in a way totally different than in any of the later films.

The Empire Strikes Back is regarded by many fans of the series as the best of the bunch. The acting and script rise several notches from its predecessor with the characters becoming less two dimensional and more interesting, yet these do not detract from the breakneck pace of the film, with some truly breathtaking action scenes. John Williams score is probably another reason why so many fans rate this so highly. Though the main themes from the first movie are all present and correct, the films darker tone is reflected perfectly in the soundtrack. Yet there are still moments of hope (the swelling strings as Yoda gives Luke a pointed lesson that "size matters not). Oh yes, and there's also the matter of THAT revelation! Possibly the best twist in movie history. Overall, movies don't get much better than this.

Everyone has already commented for the most part better than I could on how great this movie truly is. It is the best of all the Star Wars movies. I watch it from time to time to forget the hideous Jar Jar Binks and my only solace is knowing that he will be killed in a bad way in the next movie.

The Empire Strikes Back is, simply put, the best movie ever made. Who among us was not stunned the first time we heard Darth Vader's revelation to Luke? For all intent and purpose Darth Vader was just a robotic villian in A New Hope. Now he was a suffering man underneath that armor, one who just happened to be the father of the protagonist. This movie deepened the Star Wars saga in other ways. It introduced us to the Buddhist aspects of the Force through Yoda. Lando Calrissian was a smuggler with more intrigue than Han Solo in my opinion. Too bad his character was not further developed in Return of the Jedi. The visuals of Cloud City, with its pink and purple sky and dome shaped buildings, opened up the imaginations of so many children. We also got our first glimpse of Emperor Palpatine, although he was not yet truly brought to life until Ian McDiarmid played him three years later. Perhaps one of the finest scenes is Luke's journey into his dark unconscious via the cave on Dagobah. Of course, I cannot forget to mention the epic Hoth battle with the Imperial Walkers or the chase through the asteroid field. There is not a weak or unnecessary second in this movie.

Review_Title: (Arguably) the best of the original trilogy
Review: The Empire Strikes Back is a rare gem in that it, in many eyes, surpasses the original. From the very beginning, showing the improved special FX of the probe droids crashing down onto the ice planet of Hoth, the audience is hooked. The beginning of the movie continues to amaze, with the Imperial vs. Rebel battle in the snowy plains, and, more importantly, showing an array of character development. For example, Luke's recklessness and determination to become a Jedi, Han Solo and Princess Leia's wonderfully-crafted love story, (which far surpasses the new prequel trilogy's heart-on-your-sleeve awkward love story), and the main characters being divided into several different stories and places. Overall, a brilliant, fun film. 9/10

This is the movie that defined the Imperials.  It is clearly the best Star Wars movie because the effects and gadgets were used just to enhance the setting, not tell the story.  The fact that is was essentially written and directed by someone other than Lucas is probably why there is more human emotion and connection between the audience and characters.  Hopefully Lucas will realize he's better as a producer and technology advocate and little more when he begins production on Episode III.

Review_Title: I miss Jar-Jar, but it's still the perfect picture
Review: A movie without beginning and without end. The movie which, for many who say they love Star Wars, covers up for the other five other movies.

Review_Title: The Sci-Fi Masterpiece of Generation X
Review: Personally, I really kinda' hate "Generation X" as the tag line for my generation. Nonetheless, it is the label that has been given to my age group and I shall use it as a frame of reference here.

Review_Title: Best Star Wars picture EVER, a timeless classic, and a literal MUST-SEE
Review: The darkest and most epic film in the Star Wars franchise. This production teaches the audience 3 valuable lessons. 1. Not always will the good guys win. 2. Disobedience, recklessness and stupidity always have negative consequences. and 3. You will see how big a shocker can plot twists be.

This was a great movie. Yoda made his first appearance and trained Luke to be a Jedi. As Leia and Han traveled in the Falcon, they fell in love. They thought they had escaped the Empire but Boba Fett tracked them down. After Han was frozen in Carbonite, Leia, Chewbacca and Lando tried to save him but they failed. When Vader told Luke that he was his father, I thought that he was lying. But everybody learned that it was the truth. A lot of people are mistaken about what Vader said. People think that Vader said "Luke I am your father." But he didn't say that. He did in fact say "No I am your father." I didn't like Hoth or Degobah too much. But I liked the rest of it. If you haven't seen this movie, watch it.

One of the most quotable and influential movies of all time gets a sequel, and who would have guessed, it's extremely quotable and influential. Empire is one of those rare sequels that improves on the original. It takes all the great parts of Star Wars and develops them further. Masterfully crafted from a technical perspective, empire strikes back is just as innovative as the original. Where Empire distinguishes it's self is in the characters. This is where Luke Skywalker becomes Luke Skywalker, Han Solo becomes Han Solo and Darth Vader proves to be the greatest cinematic antagonist in film history. Every character and scene is iconic and memorable, with a story that satisfies while subverting the expectations of it audience. Harrison Ford and James Earl Jones give more than memorable performances with dialogue that come across as cheesy without the right actor behind it. Williams provides music that could inject any scene with intense emotion. With the most iconic movie twist in history, the story takes you on a ride that you can't help but want more of when the film comes to a close. Hopeful and charming, Empire is one of those movies that define a generation.

Review_Title: My favourite Star Wars movie...possibly my favourite movie
Review: This has always been my favourite movie of the OT. Star Wars (A New Hope) is a sentimental favourite and it introduces us the to Star Wars universe and characters but I think Empire is the better movie.
The Empire Strikes Back is the ultimate sequel to the first (or fourth) film in the Star Wars saga, and also the best film.

Review_Title: The best movie of all time
Review: I genuinely believe that Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes back is the greatest movie of all time. Besides it being superior to all other instalments of the Star Wars saga, it is superior to all other movies ever created. An amazing sequel to the film that kicked off the best entertainment franchise ever created, making an empire of its own.
Couldn't ask for anything better! Story is excellent, visuals far beyond its time. Never lets you breath for a nano-second. Watch the movie until you can't watch it anymore.

This movie is as prefect as possible. It's incredibly dark and sophisticated screenplay by Lawerence Kasdan uses new planets and characters use everything a sequel needs to do to be great. Also, It's performances are all phenomenal from Harrison Ford to Carrie Fisher to even Mark Hamill. It doesn't stop there! The Empire Strikes Back suceeds with great direction by Irvin Kirchner, Score by John Williams (Obviously!), Cinematography, Sound, Production Design, Costume Design, Film Editing, and acourse VFX by ILM. Not only is it the greatest Star Wars or Scfi, but the greatest sequel of all time.

Review_Title: One of the best sequels ever
Review: It astounds me how this film isn't higher. As a Star Wars film, it is amazing and even as a regular film, the dialogue, direction, performance, effects, and emotional weight is amazing
Amazing. This is the best movie ever and everyone should be forced to watch it

Review_Title: Excellent, the best star wars movie out of the star wars saga! 10/10
Review: I love this movie I've seen it 20 times, mainly because now that we have Disney+. If I had to describe this movie in one word it would be shocking, just because there is only one shocking scene at the very end.

Review_Title: The best of the Star Wars Trilogy by far.
Review: The Empire Strikes Back has remained one of my favorite films since I saw it as a seven year old in a theater on the Ocean City Boardwalk (NJ). It was the first movie I really cared about--its offbeat and dark atmosphere is still a treat--and it introduced me to a wide range of cinema. Few blockbuster movies are as unconventional and audacious. Unlike the other two Star Wars movies, ESB can be taken seriously or not taken seriously at all and still be thoroughly enjoyed.

I saw all three star wars movies as a kid. Of all three I can safely say that ESB is by far the best. From the action and suspense to the wonderfully crafted story, it definitely is the best. In fact since the star wars movies are my favs and ESB is my favorite of the three, ESB is my all time favorite movie. It's great! Watch it, feel it, be one with the movie.

Review_Title: Best of the Star Wars movies
Review: I think The Empire Strikes Back is the best of the three. While Star Wars was certainly a pioneer in special effects and it introduced the trilogy as well as it could, it was a Western in space, essentially, with all the hokiness and formulaic storyline. I don't like the Western genre, so it doesn't get my vote. Return of the Jedi has brilliance in its own right, but its flashiness overwhelms most elements of story. The Empire Strikes Back has something the other two lack, a darkness and foreboding that makes it more suspenseful and altogether more satisfying. It also contains the crucial element in the entire Star Wars storyline, the little fact revealed at the end.

Review_Title: You can't spell BEST without TESB. Need I say more?
Review: Undoubtably the best of the triolgy, TESB explores more than just action sequences.  The story itself seems to flow and come alive more than the other two in the series because it deals with emotions and a deeper, more serious story of personal struggles.

This movie is the greatest of the original trilogy and in my eyes is second only to Star Wars: Episode 1 The Phantom Menace.  This installment has emotion, action, plot twists and is a pure joy to watch.

Most of the time in movie history, sequels have been half-herted, never living up to the first movie. But that trend stopped in 1980 when (in my terms) the best sequel of all time: Empire Strikes Back. This movie shined on the evil Imperial forces shining, the Rebels fleeing, and romance building. It's a great movie to watch with the other 2 great films, or just by itself!

About the four movies, this is the most intense and dramatic of all the Star Wars Saga. Best of all is the revelations in the relation between Vader and Luke. The last sequence is one of the best in the story or movies.
Whereas the fourth and sixth episodes suffer from some minor blemishes (the first installment has too many to mention), Episode V is sacrosanct.

Because I grew up with Star Wars, I have always found it difficult to choose a favorite episode in the Star Wars Trilogy.  I love them all equally. However, I do like The Empire Strikes Back very much for many of the same reasons that Samuel (see previous comment) did.  It seems that the characters really find themselves in this film.  They come to grips with who they are and what they're doing in life.  Some of the awkwardness of A New Hope is shed and they begin to (if I may use a clichÃ©) blossom.  I think it's a perfect middle story, it has a nice cliffhanger, yet it never disappoints you!

The Empire Strikes Back is the greatest movie of all time.  It doesn't depend on the first movie for characters and action.  It however sets up the beautiful plot conflicts and scenes that help move the series.  Basically there is no better movie in the series.  No other movie has this many surprises and emotional scenes as this one.  'Nuff Said.

OK, I've been reading these comments. We all know the film(s). So if you're looking for a movie description, get out of the cave and go see it like the rest of mankind has. The rest can read on. Now, I'm no pro critic, but I do tend to look at things with a broad mind and try to capture the universal sense in everything. First, as far as "pros" are concerned, this IS the best of the 3. Phantom doesn't count. Not bad but not the Stars Wars I grew up with and love. Second, most true fans are in agreement that ESB is the best as well (myself included). This is also probably my favorite movie of all time. What is the point to this comment then? I really wish I could know the age and background of some of these people making comments. It says a lot. I'll admit when I saw ROTJ back in '83 ( I'm 26 now), I thought it ruled. I still love it, but time has changed me and what made a great movie back then isn't the same as what makes a great movie now. (THE FOLLOWING ARE GENERALIZED, MADE UP COMMENTS BY ME WHICH GIVE A CONCENSUS ON THE MATTER IN QUESTION)  When I see comments like "ROTJ or HOPE or PHANTOM (God for bid) was better because it had more spaceships, more fighting, action", I just roll my eyes. THAT makes a movie?? I think not. Or others saying ESB started well (battle on Hoth) but lost steam because it wandered off in character development(luke and yoda, han and leia, vader's obsession) or something like that. PLEASE! "OH NO! is that a STORY getting in the way of my eye-candy!!" I'll bet most people who say things like that are either kids or people who think "Goodfellas" is a bigger feat than the "The Godfather" because it had "more action", thought Titanic was a stupid, mushy love story...or worse, are narrow-minded enough to reduce "Godfather" to a mere gangster movie. Open your eyes!! Neither of the other insallments in the trilogy compare to the ESB's deapness, character development or suspense. Though Hope is nice mix of its sequels qualities. Great movie! Don't get me wrong! The human soul loves a struggle. win or lose. In fact, not "winning" makes it all the more poignant.But the Rebels didn't really LOSE. They narrowly avoided disaster. Had Luke been caught or killed, true victory would have gone to the Dark Side and the Emperor...the true Evil is story. And all hope would have been lost. For as long as the Dark Side lives, the Rebels could never truly win. Also, if DiCaprio had lived in Titanic, the impact on us would have been weaker. See what I mean? In conclusion, I have been one of the trilogy's biggest fans for 20 years. I love them all BUT I'll be the first to crititize them when compared with eachother. And in true artistic, refined cinema quality, ESB is unsurpassed. It does it all. Makes you laugh, cry, cheer, mourn, wonder and most importantly-FEEL. Sure, if you're not in touch with your feelings and refuse to be overcome with emotion because it's "wimpy" then the extent of your movie appreciation will be razzle-dazzle action and special effects. ESB has all that plus a lot more. Watch for the next 2 films. They will be better than Phantom for that reason.Especially the next one-a winding, complex epic full of ups and downs, tension, a romantic subplot( anakin and the queen with obi-wan in the mix)and an unpredictable ending. Sound familiar?? The third will be the darkest of all episodes. Apocolyptic. Remember the state of the galaxy when HOPE starts compared to Phantom!! May the faint hearted stay home!( MY COMMENTS ON THE UPCOMING PREQUELS ARE BASED MAINLY ON ARTICLES FROM MOVIE MAGAZINES AND IN PART PART ON MOVIE FAMILIARITY)

Review_Title: A more romantic, serious & darker episode to the holy trilogy...
Review: GEORGE LUCAS has inspired all of us STAR WARS lovers with STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE in 1977, in 1980 he then brought us STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK. THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK (second in the STAR WARS TRILOGY) is a much darker film, with more drama, romance and evil. Being a more dramatic film is actually quite heart warming at times, JOHN WILLIAM's fantastic musical score and the actors of the film have helped a lot to make the dramatic scenes...dramatic.

Review_Title: BEST OF THE STAR WARS SAGA
Review: EMPIRE STRIKES BACK is the best of the STAR WARS saga hands down. And if PHANTOM MENACE is any indication, it will remain the best once George Lucas completes the other two prequels.
This is my favorite movie!!! It's so great. It's probably the best sequel of all time and is just great.
It is not as good as A New Hope, but The Empire Strikes Back is one of the greatest sequels and films ever made!
Llove this movie. after a long time watch this kind of movie

Review_Title: The best directed Star Wars film (so far)
Review: Of the Star Wars franchise, this film is the best directed, has the best cinematography, and has the best score.  Irvin Kershner has been noted on not seeing "eye-to-eye" on some directorial decisions with George Lucas. From what I understand, George likes (at least in 1979) to keep camera direction simple and did not like to set up complex camera shots.  Irvin uses the moving camera very well and very subtly.  The cinematography is also beautiful.  My favorite sequence of all the SW films is the final lightsaber dual.  This is so well directed and lit with the contrasting blues and oranges intermixed that it really comes to life.  The score is one of John William's best.  Here you have so many themes.  My favorite is Vader's theme embedded within the asteroid sequence.  What I don't like about the film is the climax resolution of the film.  R2-D2 makes a minor adjustment, just in the nick of time and saves the ship.  The only thing lamer is ending the ending to the Phantom Menace.

Simply the best movie ever--enough said.  It is brilliant because there is no cheese, the humor is not forced, the action paces perfectly with dialogue, the musical score is superb, and it ends abruptly and surprisingly.  No Death Stars, quirky alien creatures, or bad lines where added, which made for some of the most heartfelt and emotional scenes in the history of filmmaking.  This is space opera as it was meant to be--where the fat that the film takes place in space is not the overriing theme, but rather a question of good and evil with complicated, graying, adult questions (Is Vader Luke's Father? Does Leia love Han? Is Lando a traitor? Are Ben and Yoda being truthful/helpful to Luke?)  Watch this again and again and again.

Obviously it's not only my favorite movie, it's definitely one of the best movies in the world, it's got great cinematography and a perfect pill with music. I'm sure one of the last scenes in particular is one of the best movie scenes in the world, maybe the best.
One of the best movies that i saw. This movie is fantastic!

Easily the best star wars film of the set! However, if you're reading this comment, then you will have most probably seen "a new hope" (first film) and therefore wont need much persuading........You will not be disappointed in any way!!! Without giving anything away, just imagine more of the first film but in a bigger, faster and therefore, better fashion.....As usual, the special FX are amazing considering date of production. To be honest, if you're reading this having not seen the film, you should be ashamed and My advice would be,to buy the trilogy boxset - it will soon become a prized possession, one of them that you WILL watch over and over again...If you have seen it, then you know what I'm talking about and no doubt love the film as much as i do!!!!
There is nothing to comment, it is the best of the saga.

Review_Title: Possibly the greatest film of all time
Review: Not just the best Star Wars movie by far... not even one of the best sequels ever... but strong contender for greatest movie of all time.

Review_Title: Hands down, the best Star Wars movie.
Review: ***SPOILERS***   ***SPOILERS*** Whenever my friends and I discuss Star Wars, I always say that Empire Strikes Back is the best of them.  Why?  Because it added not only emotion and conflict into the series, it asserted that the Empire and Dark Side of the force have tremendous power despite the Death Star getting blown up. It also made the Empire seem as hated as ever.  No one could have ever expected that Darth Vader was Luke's father, and the big question mark left at the end of the movie made everyone want to come back for more.

Review_Title: It Is A Dark Time For The Rebellion
Review: The Empire Strikes Back is the second instalment of the classic Star Wars saga. It is widely regarded as the best in the entire series in which I completely agree... In the hands of director for hire Kershner, a more satisfying character study of the relationships between the lead actors is achieved. Although credit should be given to Lucas for setting up these interesting characters and assembling a great cast to begin with.

Review_Title: This Is Without A Doubt The Greatest Movie I've Ever Seen
Review: Star Wars has always been a big part of my life. I've watched them since I was 4 and I never get tired of them and I literally leave a Star Wars movie on every night when I go to bed. But I have to say that I agree with the users of IMDb, The Empire Strikes Back is the greatest of the Star Wars trilogy.

One of my all time favorite movies. In this business there are few titles I can personally recommend in such a way to entice you to watch and though I vie to create an atmosphere of interest surrounding titles that I think people would enjoy, little can be done in some cases to truly convey the urgency to get out of the daily routine and sit back to relax only to hopefully be pushed out to the edge of your seat by watching a movie. This movie is one of the finest examples of a science fiction trilogy should be. Empire is definitely on a regular rotation list for me in my home. Every so many years I will throw on the 3 Star Wars movies only to find that it is Empire Strikes Back, that leaves me still wanting more and more. See it if you can, stand alone it will be enough to make you watch the entire trilogy.

In my opinion, The Empire Strikes Back is the greatest movie ever made. The pacing of the story is excellent to the extent that the viewer is never bored as the action just keeps on coming. The content of this film appears to be of a far more adult nature than any of the other Star Wars films.In this film the characters seem to come alive in a way that other science fiction films are simply unable to match. In no other Star Wars film does the audience learn more about the main characters then in The Empire Strikes Back.It should be mentioned that Yoda in particular is a remarkable creation as he is very interesting as a character as well as being very original in design. In Empire, the direction is first rate as is the acting which is a complement that one cannot honestly pay any of the other Star Wars films. In The Empire Strikes Back, the audience not only gets the usual  dose of action that is expected in a Star Wars film but also a healthy dose of romance and spiritualism as well. If you are after a film which has great action, a dark atmosphere, great characters and an excellent plot, then watch The Empire Strikes Back. I would give The Empire Strikes Back 10/10.

I wish I was there when it came out in theaters in 1980. Empire Strikes Back is my favorite movie of all time. Great action, great storyline, great acting (especially by Harrison Ford). A movie full of emotions and style, with great special effects even today. And who doesn't remember the biggest twist in movie history? "I am your father".

The Empire Strikes Back, from this point on to be referred to as Empire, is truly the greatest film I have ever seen.  Why?  I could give many reasons, most of which would have been said before.  However, this film really does have a completely different feel to it compared to Episodes IV and VI. People say it's dark, and it is, but there is a lot more to it.  There is this transitional feel about the characters and the movie, something which shows how our intrepid heroes are being forced into darkness.  Luke Skywalker, is learning about his past and the powers that he has inherited from his estranged father.  This also introduces Yoda into the saga.  Han Solo and Leia are falling in love, this changes Solo's character from the out and out space cowboy, so to speak, that we know from Episode IV.  He has mellowed and found different priorities in his life.  This is definitely the middle ground for the development of this character.  I never liked what he became in Episode VI, his role in the movie was poor and he had changed a lot from the loveable "rogue" that we saw in Episode IV.  Leia's character had changed from a slightly stuck up "princess" in Episode IV to a more "lets get down to it" action character who was not afraid to get stuck in, fix equipment and shoot a blaster.  Then we have all the obvious plot developments.  Seriously, a great film.  For me Harrison Ford, aka Han Solo, is the star of the film.  His character was a whiny, annoying kid (like we see from his father in Episodes I and II) in Episode IV but in Empire we see the beginnings of the man he becomes.  There is so much about this film, and the characters, that make it No #1!  Add all this in and is it any surprise that this is the film where George Lucas didn't write any of the script, or direct it?  His only contribution was to write the story.  A lot of people would see this and hope that Lucas doesn't direct or write the script for the highly anticipated Episode III.  Unfortunately, I'm one of them.

Review_Title: My favorite movie in the series!
Review: One of my happiest memories as a kid is going to the theaters with my father and watching A New Hope, The Empire Strikes Back and Return of The Jedi. I saw the original trilogy when I was 9. Dad took me out of fourth grade and faked the dentist appointment and took me in it.
This has to be my favorite movie off them all.

I watched the Empire Strikes Back for the first time since I can remember the other day and let me tell you. . . Wow! This really may be the greatest sequel ever made. It has a darker tone, more character depth, and one of the greatest twists in cinematic history. Most sequels get caught up in doing exactly what the originals did or something completely new and not remembering its roots. Episode V was perfectly balanced between the two aspects. A landmark in cinema, The Empire Strikes Back will continue to entertain and captivate movie-goers forever and with the new trilogy coming out will have a lot to live up to.

Review_Title: A Classic that is a must watch
Review: This is one of my favorite films. It is a great mix of action, drama, and adventure. I would suggest that when watching this film, to watch the Theatrical version first because the special effects can be too distracting. It is the darker film of the trilogy, but still fine for the family.

Review_Title: My first Star Wars at a theatre
Review: Simply the biggest pop phenomenon ever. Star Wars is a passion for millions and ESB is one of the best movies of the saga
The Empire Strikes Back is the easily the best Star Wars movie.

Never in the history of cinema has a sequel surpassed what the first time has done. Empire Strikes Back is what every sequel longs to be... full of humor, suspense, tears, and introduces new characters that we end up caring more for than some of the originals.

Review_Title: The High Point of the saga
Review: TESB is what can I say THE BEST STAR WARS FILM BY A MILE!!! I tell you my friends although the other Star wars movies may be excellent The Empire Strikes back is perfect. A brilliant piece of movie making. One of the things better about this one was the dialogue, this is the only Star Wars movie that has really good dialogue and also may I say the acting in this movie is brilliant and far better than the acting in the Prequel Trilogy ( Except for Ian Mcdiarmid of course ). The Plot twist in this movie is amazing when Darth Vader says to Luke "I am your father" I still shiver. Also another thing about this movie is Vader, he is delightfully ruthless in this movie.Best film of them all. Well done Lucas and everyone else involved in making this movie.

The Empire Strikes Back is in my opinion the best Star Wars movie. Its balanced combination of action,adventure,character development and plot is what i ask from a movie,especially when it is a space-opera movie. Darth Vader is much more interesting here as a villain than ''A New Hope'',where he was a villain just for the plot. The action sequences are much better and frequent,the places are more interesting and beautiful,like the ''city in the clouds''. The famous plot-twist is quite shocking i must say, but for me it was spoiled, as i started the saga with the prequels(and it was wrong). Even though it was a good plot twist, i think the ''i am your father'' scene is not well-done because it is a bit unnatural and the dialogue is a bit cheesy. But overall, The Empire Strikes Back is one the best fantasy movies i've ever seen and it was very enjoyable for me to watch. Furthermore, i believe it is one of the best sequels of all time.

Review_Title: 2nd Star Wars and an AMAZING film
Review: Who would have thought that this would be the greatest film and sequel ever made? There are many good things about The Empire Strikes Back.

Simply the best of all the Star Wars movies. My favourite movie. Must of seen it 2000 times and still laugh at the cracks and enjoy the story.

A well crafted jewel that expands your mind and imagination.

Truly a timeless masterpiece.

Review_Title: My favourite movie of all time
Review: I donÂ´t think i need to say anithing everything about this movie is perfect

Review_Title: is it really a good addition to the star wars saga?
Review: i think the empire strikes back is really disappointing.did george lucas really need to add this to the saga.the only bit worth a mark is the lightsaber fight at the end and the dark secret.from the hoth battle its just a downward hill struggle up till the duel.its a good job i watched this in about 3 parts cause if i'd have watched it all together i would have fell asleep.i can never watch this all the way from hoth to the lightsaber battle.darth vader,emperor palpatine and Luke skywalker are the only characters worth a mention they are a good asset to the story.if it were'not for them empire strikes back would have skipped my DVD collection for ever.so 6/10 a really wasted effort to the star wars saga.
Very good movie,

This movie is amazing. Its practical effect and visual effects still holds up today the story is amazing I will not go into it to avoid spoilers but this film definitely takes on a darker tone then then a new hope and return of the Jedi this is one of the best movies ever made and by far the best star wars movie. With twits and turns all around this movie is definitely worth a watch. If you haven't seen any of the star wars movies I would recommend watching them in release order as it saves some information that is spoiled in the prequels. Also watching the prequels is not necessary as it ruins some concepts that were prominent in the original trilogy

This Star Wars movie was the darkest film with quality characters. In this film you get to know the characters properly. I love the interaction between Han Solo and Princess Leia, as well as many other great characters that are introduced and developed further.

To me, "Empire" is the perfect illustration of a B-series movie state of grace. Not only this one is the best of all in the "Star Wars" anthology, even better than the Lucas's ones, in all respects, but it is a true lesson of cinema. I use to say that it is "Casablanca" in space. (look at the poster !)

Empire strikes back brings a tension of evil and darkness. The most darkest science-fiction of all times (more than Revenge of the Sith) I always felt a shock and a fear when I was a kid about this flick. Darth Vader is a like an iron grip devastating everything on his path. The light-saber's duel is kind of dramatic and unfair for poor little Luke who's just a disciple/Jedi Knight but yet unexperienced. Ultimately "I am your father" brought the most classicism line in the Star Wars universe. I liked the battle of Hoth and frankly I found drama in the rebel's defeat rather than in Revenge of the Sith when the Jedi are betrayed. The part with Han Solo freezing carbonate is well filmed and mostly sad but still funny "I love you" "I know". This movie also introduces Yoda and his philosophy giving a remarkable atmosphere to the Star Wars universe. I was thrilled then and I am thrilled now when I watch this film. The script is well written and it proves George Lucas and Lawrence Kasdan had done an original work.

This movie is the best movie in the Star Wars series. The best part is when Luke Skywalker fights everybody's favorite the one and only... Darth Vader. But before I go into that I must tell you my review. This movie is the best in the series because it reveals the most secrets (Next to Episode III) and it is packed to the gills with action. This like all of the other ones has a lot of killing (BUT PARENTS LET YOUR KIDS SEE THIS MOVIE!)but the peoples faces are hidden beneath masks so there is little agony on peoples faces when they are shot with laser blasters. By this I am referring to Stormtroopers. In the beginning we are introduced to the new Rebel Base on Hoth an icy planet. Darth Vader is sending probe droids to find the Rebles and find Luke. Hmmm I wonder why... Luke investigates is attacked by a snow beast uses the force escapes leaves and almost freezes to death. Luke gets a message from Obi-Wan and is told to go to the Degobah system. Han goes out to look for Luke and eventually finds him. Han and Luke are forced spend a cold night on Hoth in the morning a search party finds Luke and takes them back to the Rebel base and puts Luke in a Bacta tank. Then the Rebeles find some Imperial walkers ready to destroy Echo Base. There is a battle and Han and Leia escape on the Mellenium Falcon. The Imperials are looking for Han and Leia. Then Darth Vader calls in 6 bounty hunters IG-88, Dengar, Zukuss and 4-LOM, Bossk and Boba Fett. Han and Leia are forced to flee to Cloud City on the planet Bespin during their visit they will meet up with an old "Friend" Lando Callrisean . Right as they leave we see a ship resting on an asteroid... Meanwhile Luke and R2 leave Hoth to find Yoda. They find a little creature who turns out to be Yoda. Yoda teaches Luke the ways of the force. Luke feels in the force that Han and Leia are in serious trouble so he leaves Degobah to go and save his friends. Han is put into torture to be put into Carbon Freeze. If he survives then the Empire will use the Carbon Freezeing Chamber on Luke to turn him to the dark side. It turns out that Boba Fett has also made it to Cloud City. Han survives carbon freeze then is taken with Boba Fett to visit Jabba the Hutt. Luke arrives in cloud city to find Darth Vader in his trap. Luke and Vader have a lightsaber battle while Leia Lando Chewbacca R2 and C3-P0 escape. In the end of the battle Luke gets his hand chopped off along with his fathers lightsaber. Vader says the lines " I am your father." Luke is hanging on a platform over an abyss then lets go to escape the dark side. Luke almost dies because he is hanging on a pole after being sucked into an exhaust vent. Then his friends Leia and Lando save him from death. I loved this movie so much that I used to freeze my Han Solo toy and pretend that he was in Carbon Freeze. Now watch the movie and see if you liked it as much as I did. If you want it real bad buy it on DVD with the bonus disk. May the force be with you!

One of those rare moments in cinematic history when the stars aligned in an axis of perfection.

Everything is right, plot,writng, environments, characters, character development, visualisation and musical score......all sublime.

Not just the greatest Star Wars film but also one of the greatest films of all time.

It was great at everything

Iam officially fan of han solo and darth vader

Dialogues were good and screenplay was well written, Harrison ford nailed it as Han solo

Very first review of Star Wars V, better I'm watched TV cause I'm beautiful experience, Luke get lost hand by Darth Vader also but can, I'm not cool better so, trying so nothing can make on TV, Okay? So very awesome!

Review_Title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
Review: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980). The perfect sequel to Star Wars. Included in the movie, we see the introduction of three characters. Each playing important roles that lead to the events of the end of The Empire Strikes Back to Return of the Jedi. First, we see the debut of Yoda. A small hermit like creature who happens to be a former wise jedi master who helps Luke advance as a jedi and (not knowing) to prepare him for his clash between the sinister Darth Vader. Throughout the movie, we also see the appearance of Lando Calrissian. An old friend of Han who is the administrator of the cloud city of Bespin. With the introduction of Lando, comes the clash of Luke and Vader and the mercenary, Boba Fett. Although he Boba plays only plays a short roll throughout the movie, he does bring sense of unknown and interest. Boba Fett's actions have importance which further continues into Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi. We also see a range of new planets including my personal favorite Bespin, Hoth and Dagobah. With the addition of the new characters and planets, The Empire Strikes Back is really the best Star Wars film to watch for those who are new to the franchise. Even though it lacks some elements that the original had done better, I still recommend it. But I do encourage you watch the first film before you watch The Empire Strikes Back so the story makes more sense. With the movie only earning one Oscar, it is the best of the lot. Star Wars is definitely up there for being one of the greatest franchises in cinema history.
I like Star Wars. Its very interesting movie. Very very dood artists and produsers.

Nice movie nice graphiCS

anazing sound effects

screen play is nice

cast is over prited
Didn't expect the plot, was very nice to see! Enjoyed a lot!

Wow!

Star Wars has always been an amazing trilogy yet this is easily the best movie from LucasFilm yet.

This is Tim Robbins best performance ever. It is a compelling heart warming drama about an innocent man(Andy Dufresbe) who is sent to prison and learns to use his intelligence to make the best of prison life. He meets a mentor in Red(Morgan Freeman) and they build a friendship that is stronger than the walls that surround them. Andy steadies a relationship with the warden that keeps him in the good eyes of the prison. Andy is full of surprises and uses his resourcefulness to not only win the friendships of his fellow prisoners, but also of the prison guards. Both Andy and Red both hold on to their dream of one day enjoying their freedom. They turn their friendship and dreams of freedom into a bond that no prison could ever take away.

As if being a part of the most successful series ever, Empire stands as the best movie ever.  Though it could not exist without its counterparts, its plot complexities, character development and superlative story telling allow it to reign superior.  Even though it was the least successful of the the trilogy, most critics agree it is the best of the series.  It accepts its role as a single part of a series and takes the most signficant strides to give the Star Wars saga meaning.

Review_Title: The best sequel of all time!
Review: It starts off kind of slow, compared to Star Wars, but picks up during the battle on Hoth. We see Luke begin his Jedi training with Yoda, the romance between Han Solo and Princess Leia begin, and some beautiful special effects. My favourite exchange takes place on the Millenium Falcon between Solo and Leia, during the chase through the asteriod belt:
All the Star wars episodes are great, but this is the best one. This is actually the best movie that has ever been made.  At least in my opinion.

Empire Strikes Back is the best movie in the trilogy and of all time.  With great acting, story script, plot, special effects, and directing, no wonder why it was so good.  I recommend this to those who haven't seen it.

Review: I've seen this movie lots of times, and I must say I never get tired of it. Some friends tell me IÂ´m crazy about watching it so many times, but I just donÂ´t get bored. As it is the one in the middle, Empire strikes back is the CLIMAX of the Star Wars Trilogy.From the first battle in the snow to lightsaber fight between Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker, this movie is full of action, adventure and suspense! If you havenÂ´t seen it, do so.

Review_Title: This is the best movie that I'd ever seen
Review: This movie is the greater of the saga because it had a lot of suspense. In the special edition this suspense is greater (In Hoth;the Wampa scene,in Cloud City;the arrival of Darth Vader to the Star Destroyer) I was qualified with a 10 and give you the recommendation to see it.

Review_Title: Definitely the best film in the Star Wars Trilogy
Review: The thing I like about 'The Empire Strikes Back' is that it's not formulaic in the Hollywood tradition. In 'Star Wars' no sooner had they destroyed the Death Star, they were awarding each other medals. Too neat, I think. Life is never that simple. In the sequel we have a reality check in no uncertain terms:The Alliance got thrashed;the hero had a hand lopped off and his best buddy was reduced to an ice cube. To cap it all, the hero's pop is revealed as a bit of a bad lad-setting Luke up for a conflict of duty and emotion in the final film. All in all, a Lucas tour de force (pun intended).
Splendid performance....actors well organized and very creative...very entertaining indeed!!!
By far the best film of the series as well as my favorite movie of all time. There is nothing else out there that sucked me in as this movie did.

Review_Title: From a paper I wrote on the film...
Review: In opposition to Return of the Jedi, The Empire Strikes Back usually gets the nod as being the favorite installment.  This becomes increasingly interesting as one looks more closely at the film.  Starting and ending seemingly in mid-sentence, with the characters separated and following different plot lines, Empire has more in common with Ulysses than the standard Hollywood blockbuster.  Rather than following in the footsteps of the first film and depicting a sunny, neatly sewn up story with the requisite happy ending, this film descends into darkness and despair. Throughout the film the protagonists are chased across the galaxy, they generally lose every conflict they enter into, are variously dismembered, double-crossed, shot at, swallowed whole, traumatized, dropped from great heights and frozen in carbonite.  The Romantic tradition would demand that the bad guys pay dearly for these various insults, but astoundingly the bad guys actually seem to win.  In light of the success of this film, it seems that no one minded.

Review_Title: This is the greatest movie ever.
Review: This is the best film of the Star Wars series. The characters and the story are superb. Of course the effects and the action is great. This is my all-time favorite movie.

Review_Title: Back and better than the original
Review: The Empire Strikes Back is in my opinion a superior movie to the original Star Wars.  Many true Star Wars fans would agree with me on this.  The characters, action, and overall plot of Empire is greater than its predecessor.  The ending is less predictable and is at the same time relevant to its title.  True, it's not as original as Star Wars because the basic aspects are similar and for that reason may not be regarded the "greater" movie, but I think that Empire at least attempts and in my opinion succeeds in breaking the old rule that sequels are never as good as the originals.  It is because of these reasons that The Empire Strikes Back is my favorite movie of all time.

Review_Title: This movie has never stopped resonating within me.
Review: It took the release of the worst, most disappointing film of all time (The Phantom Menace) for me to realize that ESB is my favorite movie of all time. Aside from the great story, characters, acting, dialogue, art direction, etc. etc. etc. -- it is simply the most primal, mythic, formative movie of my childhood. No movie has ever captured good vs. evil so well. Let's hope Lucas can make Episodes 2 and 3 somewhat closer to ESB and further from the awful crap of Phantom Menace.

Review_Title: Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back, the greatest film of all time
Review: I am in shock after reviewing this list of the top 250 films of all-time. Now, the Godfather and the Shawshank Redemption should be in the top 10, but they are the only movies I see in the top ten that deserve to be there. The Lord of the Rings the Return of the King was a great movie, but not top ten worthy, and the same goes for the Godfather Part II. Schindler's List was a good movie as well, but not top ten worthy. I have no say on Cuckoo's Nest and Citizen Kane, but Casablanca should be in the top 20, not the top 10. And then comes the Seven Samaurai, some dumb, stupid, idiotic Japanese movie. That movie does not even have enough votes to be that high, and anyway, maybe it should be in the top 200, but no better. Pulp Fiction is the movie in this list that gets me. This film is garbage that should have never made it past the editors desk. It is just so terrible. Let's waste time talking about a hamburger, what a boring movie. Where is Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes back though. It does not even appear in the top ten. It is number 14, which is totally incorrect. This film has by far the one of the most memorable lines in cinema history. Only the Godfather could beat it, no other. I cannot not believe the fact that this movie is not in the top five and that other not as good movies are. Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back has the greatest score in film history with the Imperial March and has the greatest battles in film history. This is the greatest film ever made and should be number 1.

'The Empire Strikes Back' is the best of the 'Star Wars'-movies to date. There's something special about this episode, it has something that the other episodes hasn't. I can't say what it is, really. It's just so...

I remember as a 10 year old child seeing this movie when it was first released back in 1980.  I was completely awestruck by the special effects, characters, and the incredible plot-twist at the ending. Now, 20 years later, nothing has changed.  "The Empire Strikes Back" still leaves me with a feeling that no movie before or after ever has.  A feeling that I have just seen the absolute pinnacle of cinematic masterpieces.  I have never seen the "Special Edition".  I never intend to.  I want to rememberr TESB as it was originally released.  Because, in my opinion, there is no improvement on perfection.

I have seen this movie many times, and each time I see it it gets better and better.  It has everything,romance, action, suspense and catches you in the end with a twist ending.  To really appreciate this film one has to look past the fact that it is a cult classic.  Watch it as a movie not as "one of those geeky science-fiction films".

Excellent, led by Star Wars veteran Paul Hirsch, but it is known that both George Lucas, and his then wife Marcia were also heavily involved in putting the film together. Peter Suschitzky's photography is more conventional and low key in approach than A New Hope, but is particularly effective on the Dagobah scenes in Elstree Studios, and the location scenes in Norway.

I could say so much about how great this movie is but will instead recommend that anyone with an interest in film watch one of the greatest scenes ever: the carbon freezing scene.  Everything is perfect in that scene from the patience Kershner has to let the emotion build, to the incredible use of music, to the cinematography.  It is a scene where almost no dialogue is spoken and yet more emotion is conveyed from each character present than perhaps any other scene ever put on film.  For a director to achieve such an effect with no dialogue is the mark of a truly great directing.  Every film student should study it frame by frame. There is no way George Lucas could have filmed that scene and thank god he didn't try.
